com.carnival.sdk

Class Carnival

  • com.carnival.sdk.Carnival

  • public class Carnival

    Keeps track of necessary environment variables provided by the developer or google. Also provides the entry point into Carnival for the developer to retrieve device information.

      • EXTRA_PARCELABLE_MESSAGE

        protected static java.lang.String EXTRA_PARCELABLE_MESSAGE

        Now for internal use only. Protected to prevent users expecting this to be there when it is no longer reliable after the addition of mid to the push payload.

      • setInAppNotificationsEnabled

        public static void setInAppNotificationsEnabled(boolean enabled)

        Enables or disables the display of In-App Notifications. Must be called before com.carnival.sdk.Carnival$startEngine(android.content.Context,java.lang.String). In-App Notifications are enabled by default.

        Parameters:
        enabled - false to disable In-App Notifications and true to re-enable.
        See Also:
        com.carnival.sdk.Carnival$startEngine(android.content.Context,java.lang.String)

      • startEngine

        public static void startEngine(android.content.Context context,
                               java.lang.String appKey)

        Initialises The Carnival SDK. See documentation Connecting to Carnival for usage.

        Parameters:
        context - Application Context
        appKey - The Carnival App Key of your application on the Carnival platform.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if context or appKey are null.
        See Also:
        Connecting to Carnival

      • setGeoIpTrackingEnabled

        public static void setGeoIpTrackingEnabled(boolean enabledGeoIp)

        Enabled location tracking based on IP Address. Tracking location tracking is enabled by default. Use this method for users who may not want to have their location tracked at all.

        Parameters:
        enabledGeoIp - A boolean value indicating whether or not to disable location based on IP Address.

      • setGeoIpTrackingEnabled

        public static void setGeoIpTrackingEnabled(boolean enabledGeoIp,
                                           @Nullable
                                           com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.CarnivalHandler<java.lang.Void> handler)

        Enabled location tracking based on IP Address. Tracking location tracking is enabled by default. Use this method for users who may not want to have their location tracked at all.

        Parameters:
        enabledGeoIp - A boolean value indicating whether or not to disable location based on IP Address.
        handler - Handler for the result of enabling/disabling geo IP tracking.

      • setGeoIpTrackingDefault

        public static void setGeoIpTrackingDefault(boolean enabledGeoIp)

        Set whether location tracking based on IP Address will be enabled or disabled by default when a device is created. This method must be called before startEngine.

        Parameters:
        enabledGeoIp - A boolean value indicating whether or not location based on IP Address should be enabled by default.

      • getRecommendations

        public static void getRecommendations(java.lang.String sectionId,
                                      @Nullable
                                      com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.RecommendationsHandler handler)

        Returns the output from a Site Personalization Manager section, an array of recommendations for the given user. It is suggested you use this in conjunction with com.carnival.sdk.Carnival$setUserEmail(java.lang.String,com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.CarnivalHandler) to identify the user to Sailthru.

        Parameters:
        sectionId - A string representing the section ID for this recommendation
        handler - an anonymous instance of RecommendationsHandler. Must implement onSuccess() and onFailure().
        See Also:
        com.carnival.sdk.Carnival$setUserEmail(java.lang.String,com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.CarnivalHandler)

      • trackPageview

        public static void trackPageview(@NonNull
                                 java.net.URI url,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> tags,
                                 @Nullable
                                 com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.TrackHandler handler)

        Asynchronously registers that the given "page" has been viewed with Sailthru SPM. Note that a Content View here directly corresponds to a page view in SPM.

        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the page we're tracking a view of. Must be a valid URL with protocol (eg. http:// or https://) - this generally should correspond to the web link of the content being tracked, and the stored URL in the Sailthru content collection. This must not be null.
        tags - Tags for this page. May be null.
        handler - an instance of interface Carnival.TrackHandler. May be null, in which case onSuccess and onFailure callbacks won't be fired.

      • trackImpression

        public static void trackImpression(@NonNull
                                   java.lang.String sectionId,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.util.List<java.net.URI> urls,
                                   @Nullable
                                   com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.TrackHandler handler)

        Asynchronously registers an impression - a reasonable expectation that a user has seen a piece of content - with Sailthru SPM. Can be used in conjunction with RecyclerView.Adapter#onViewAttachedToWindow or similar to know when a particular content item has entered the user's viewport.

        Parameters:
        sectionId - the Section ID on Sailthru SPM corresponding to the section being viewed. Must not be null.
        urls - a List of the URLs of the items contained within this section. Useful if multiple items of content are contained within a section, otherwise just pass a single-item array. Must not be null.
        handler - an instance of interface Carnival.TrackHandler. May be null, in which case onSuccess and onFailure callbacks won't be fired.

      • trackClick

        public static void trackClick(@NonNull
                              java.lang.String sectionId,
                              @NonNull
                              java.net.URI url,
                              @Nullable
                              com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.TrackHandler handler)

        Asynchronously registers with Sailthru SPM that a section has been clicked/tapped on, transitioning the user to a detail view

        Parameters:
        sectionId - the ID of the section to track a click for. Must not be null.
        url - the URL of the detail being transitioned to. Must not be null.
        handler - an instance of interface Carnival.TrackHandler. May be null, in which case onSuccess and onFailure callbacks won't be fired.

                               @Nullable
                               com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.CarnivalHandler<java.lang.Void> handler)

        Clear device data.

        Parameters:
        options - A bitwise OR collection of #ATTRIBUTES, #MESSAGE_STREAM, or #EVENTS. #CLEAR_ALL can be used to clear all.
        handler - callback handler

      • setDeviceToken

        public static void setDeviceToken(java.lang.String token)

        Pass the FCM token into the Carnival SDK. NOTE: This method should only be called if the app implements its own FirebaseMessagingService instance, in which case it must be called in order to provide the FCM token to the Carnival Platform. Otherwise this will be handled automatically by the Carnival SDK.

        Parameters:
        token - FCM token provided by FirebaseMessagingService

      • handleNotification

        public static void handleNotification(com.google.firebase.messaging.RemoteMessage remoteMessage)

        Pass received notification to Carnival SDK. NOTE: This method should only be called if the app implements its own FirebaseMessagingService instance, in which case it must be called in order to provide FCM notifications to the Carnival SDK for processing. Otherwise this will be handled automatically by the Carnival SDK.

        Parameters:
        remoteMessage - FCM notification

        Set the profile vars through the SDK.

        Parameters:

        public static void getProfileVars(@Nullable

        Parameters:

      • handleSailthruLink

        public static android.net.Uri handleSailthruLink(@NonNull
                                                 android.net.Uri uri,
                                                 @Nullable
                                                 com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.CarnivalHandler<java.lang.Void> handler)

        If you're using Sailthru email with universal links, your application will open with an encoded Sailthru link url. This method will decode the link URL and return its canonical location (ie https://link.sailthru.com/blahblah will redirect to https://www.sailthru.com/careers/list/, the link's canonical location), as well as making sure that the clickthrough metrics for this link are correctly attributed in the Sailthru platform. This method should be called from your receiving activity's onStart() method, and handle the starting intent's link data

        Parameters:
        uri - the Sailthru Link to be unrolled
        Returns:
        org.jetbrains.dokka.NodeRenderContent@1ef96611: the destination that the Sailthru link points to
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the URI given isn't a Sailthru link

      • logPurchase

        public static void logPurchase(@NonNull
                               Purchase purchase,
                               @Nullable
                               com.carnival.sdk.Carnival.CarnivalHandler<java.lang.Void> handler)

        Logs a purchase with the Sailthru platform. This can be used for mobile purchase attribution.

        Parameters:
        purchase - The purchase to log with the platform.
        handler - callback handler.

        handler - callback handler.
